SunilKP-Team@corp.ds.fedex.com>


Dear Sir,



As discussed over the call,

This is regarding your import Courier shipment vide FedEx AWB No. *882341621200
*which will undergo customs clearance at BLR Gateway.

The subject shipment detained for WPC license. The WIRELESS PLANNING &
COORDINATION (WPC) Wing of the Ministry of Communications, created in 1952,
is the National Radio Regulatory Authority responsible for Frequency
Spectrum Management, including licensing and caters for the needs of all
wireless users (Government and Private) in the country.

   1. *WPC* (WIRELESS PLANNING & COORDINATION)

If you do not have WPC, requested to provide the justification letter and
mention *the AWB (Tracking) number in letter (addressed to ‘Deputy
Commissioner of Customs, Courier Cell, KIAL, Bangalore) *in letter *Specify
the reason why the WPC not available along with value evidence (purchase
order, bank remittance copy, price list or Internet price) documents and
explaining what exactly are the contents of the package, quantity, its use,
and purpose of import. However, this is only a letter* but not the document
asked by the customs. Hence this may or may be the final document to answer
the query.



Please allow us 24-48 hours for the clearance of your shipment, post
receipt of documents/clearance instructions.

In case of any further requirement, we will get in touch with you at the
earliest.

*Warehousing Fees**:*

Shipments pending clearance for more than 3 days from the date of arrival
are subject to the following demurrage/warehousing charges as applicable:

From 4 to 10 days

(INR 2.2 per kg/day) or (INR 10/day) whichever is higher

From 11 to 20 days

(INR 3.3 per kg/day) or (INR 20/day) whichever is higher

From 21 to 30 days

(INR 4.95 per kg/day)

More than 30 days

(INR 6.6 per kg/day)



*Re-imbursement charges**:*

Submission of duty charges on your behalf will attract a fee* as follows:

Duty Advanced up to INR 10,000

INR 800

Duty Advanced above INR 10,000

2.5 % of the duty paid amount

**GST additional*

Please note that according to the provisions under Regulation 5(5) of the
Courier Import and Export (Clearance) Regulation, 1998 as amended vide
Customs Notification No. 54/99) and the Courier Imports and Exports
(Electronic Declaration and Processing) regulations 2010, the shipments may
be surrendered to the customs for disposal, if not cleared within 30 days
of arrival.

Should you have any further clarifications, please do not hesitate to
contact the undersigned on the mentioned telephone numbers.









*Best regards,*



*Gowtham B* *(he, him, his)*

*|* *Clearance Admin Associate** |* *Gateway Operations** |*

*| **#* C19, Express Cargo Terminal, Kempegowda International Airport,
Bengaluru – 560300 *|*

*Thank you for choosing Fed**Ex**, Assuring you the best services always !!*




FedEx truly values and acts on all customer feedback. If you have any

Experience or my performance,

please feel free to share to the below email ID.

Sunil K P *sunil.kp@fedex.com* <sunil.kp@fedex.com> ( *Manager*)

conversations.body_text: Hi buvanesh dorairaj,     Hi, here is your order invoice,please let us know if you need any more information.

Dear Simsonn,

Thank you once again for your support in helping clear the consignment with
the invoice that was provided.

However, upon final clearance, a total of *₹7,500 Rs($87) in duty charges
and miscellaneous * was applied across the two packages, which is
significantly higher. While I truly appreciate your mention of a potential
refund of $30(*₹ *2500 Rs), I kindly request your support in *increasing
the refund amount* to help ease the burden placed on the customer due to
this unexpected charge.

Given that the delay and misclassification with WPC were beyond our
control, and the consignment was non-wireless as clearly declared, I hope
you’ll consider providing additional support in good faith.

Your assistance will go a long way in maintaining a positive customer
experience and ensuring smooth transactions in the future.

Looking forward to your understanding and a favorable consideration.


buvanesh

On Fri, Jul 4, 2025 at 8:44 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi buvanesh dorairaj,    As far as I know, India's customs are quite strict, so basically every item that passes through customs is subject to tax. However, it's not our responsibility or obligation after all, we will give up some of our profit to share some of the financial pressure for our customers, but we can only do the best we can. I will have my colleague refund you $35 on Monday, thank you for your understanding!
